title: CI/CD Guide
subtitle: Complete deployment automation for multiple platforms
overview: CodeForge includes production-ready CI/CD configurations for GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, and CircleCI. Each pipeline includes linting, testing, security scanning, Docker image building, and automated deployment workflows.

platforms.name: GitHub Actions
platforms.description: Complete CI/CD with GHCR Docker registry integration
features: Docker build and push to GitHub Container Registry

platforms.name: GitLab CI
platforms.description: Multi-stage pipeline with GitLab Container Registry

platforms.name: Jenkins
features: HTML report publishing for tests and coverage

pipeline.intro: All CI/CD configurations follow a similar multi-stage pipeline structure:

stages.description: ESLint and TypeScript type checking to ensure code quality
Unit tests with coverage reporting and result artifacts
Production build with artifact generation for deployment
Playwright end-to-end tests with HTML reports
npm audit and Trivy vulnerability scanning
Multi-stage Docker image build and push to registry
Automated deployment to staging and production environments

files.name: Dockerfile
files.description: Multi-stage build with Node.js builder and Nginx runtime

files.name: nginx.conf
files.description: Production Nginx configuration with health checks and caching

files.name: .dockerignore
files.description: Optimized build context by excluding unnecessary files

docker.commands:
# Build image locally
docker build -t codeforge:local .

# Run container
docker run -p 3000:80 codeforge:local

# Use docker-compose
docker-compose up -d

# Pull from registry
docker pull ghcr.io/<username>/<repo>:latest
features: Multi-stage build reduces final image size to ~50MB
Nginx serves static files with gzip compression
Health check endpoint at /health for orchestration
Automatic cache headers for static assets
SPA routing support with fallback to index.html

branches.name: main
branches.description: Production branch - deploys to production environment (manual approval required)

branches.name: develop
branches.description: Development branch - automatically deploys to staging environment

branches.name: feature/*
branches.description: Feature branches - runs tests only, no deployment

branches.name: v* tags
branches.description: Version tags - triggers release workflow with artifacts and changelog

quickStart.title: Monitor Pipeline
quickStart.description: View pipeline status, test results, and deployment logs in your platform's dashboard

bestPractices: Never commit secrets - use environment variables and platform secret management
Enable branch protection on main and develop branches
Require code reviews and passing tests before merging
Use manual approval gates for production deployments
Monitor security scan results and fix vulnerabilities promptly
Keep dependencies updated with Dependabot or Renovate
Use semantic versioning for releases (v1.0.0, v1.1.0, etc.)
Configure Slack or email notifications for deployment status
